name: UseXcodeVersion
description: Use the specified version of Xcode from the tool cache, optionally adding it to the PATH
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks) or [see the Xcode documentation](https://developer.apple.com/documentation)
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: Version spec
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version range or exact version of a Xcode version to use.

inputs.name: addToPath
inputs.label: Add to PATH
inputs.helpMarkDown: Prepend the retrieved Xcode version to the PATH environment variable to make it available in subsequent tasks or scripts without using the output variable.

outputVariables.name: xcodeLocation
outputVariables.description: The resolved folder of the Xcode distribution.

messages.DarwinOnly: The Use Xcode version task can only run on a Mac computer.
messages.ToolNotFoundMicrosoftHosted: If this is a Microsoft-hosted agent, check that this image supports side-by-side versions of %s at %s.
messages.ToolNotFoundSelfHosted: If this is a self-hosted agent, see how to configure side-by-side %s versions at %s.
messages.VersionNotFound: Version spec %s for architecture %s did not match any version in /Applications directory.
messages.ExactVersionNotRecommended: Specifying an exact version is not recommended on Microsoft-Hosted agents. Patch versions of Xcode can be replaced by new ones on Hosted agents without notice, which will cause builds to fail unexpectedly. It is recommended to specify only major or major and minor version (Example: `13` or `13.2`)
